intro: Cicerbita kotschyi, commonly known as the Kotschyi's cicerbita, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry conditions. Cicerbita kotschyi is often found in mountainous areas and is considered a rare species in its native range.
